paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant c.302C>T, including penetrance data and individual case details.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: At the age of 44 years, the male proband noticed numbness in the toes of his right foot, which quickly spread to both limbs.
At the age of 74 years, the male proband underwent cardiological examination due to dyspnea and chest pain that had persisted for a few years.
The familial TTR variant was detected in the proband’s phenotypically negative 47-year-old daughter (III-2).
The familial TTR variant was identified in one phenotypically negative daughter at the age of 33 years (III-4).

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with transthyretin amyloidosis, particularly affecting cardiac function.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in affected individuals.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: The homozygous state of this variant was associated with earlier disease onset and neurological involvement compared to the heterozygote state.
key_quotes: c.302C>T is a rare TTR variant associated with ATTRv cardiomyopathy.
The homozygous state of this variant was not reported before, and is associated with earlier disease onset and neurological involvement compared to the heterozygote state.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
